author: Anastasya Lavenia Yudi
title: YLKI Urges OJK to Cancel New Co-payment Rules for Health Insurance, Not Postpone Them
text:
YLKI Urges OJK to Cancel New Co-payment Rules for Health Insurance, Not Postpone Them
Reporter
July 3, 2025 | 11:44 am
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Indonesian Consumers Foundation (YLKI) urges the Financial Services Authority (OJK) to revoke the co-payment rule for health insurance risk sharing. This rule obligates policyholders to bear 10 percent of the claim costs.
YLKI considers the postponement of the regulation, agreed upon by OJK and the House of Representatives (DPR) in a meeting on Monday, June 30, 2025, as insufficient in protecting consumers. "And not in line with the initial agreement in the policy," said YLKI's Executive Secretary Rio Priambodo in a written statement to Tempo on Wednesday, July 2, 2025. He believes this policy will make consumers think twice before continuing their insurance policies.
YLKI also requests OJK to involve consumers in policy development. According to Rio, OJK should resolve fundamental issues such as claims processes and hospital services. "Resolving insurance-related issues will enhance OJK's dignity in the eyes of consumers," he said.
In a hearing with the DPR, Commission XI member Eric Hermawan asked OJK to postpone the implementation of co-payment until 2027. He believes OJK did not involve the public and did not consult with the DPR before issuing this policy. "There should be a people-oriented approach. The public should be asked if they want to adopt co-payment. The industry is the one benefiting," said Eric.
Commission XI Chairman Mukhamad Misbakhun asked OJK to change the form of the regulation from a circular letter to an official regulation. "Should not be a circular letter, but a formal regulation," he said. OJK's Executive Director of Insurance Supervision Ogi Prastomiyono stated that OJK will follow the DPR's request.
Previously, the Indonesian Life Insurance Association (AAJI) cited the surge in health insurance claims as the reason for the issuance of the co-payment rule. "Health insurance claims have been increasing from year to year, especially after the pandemic," said Head of the Claim and Benefit Department of AAJI, Dian Budiani, in a media gathering in Bogor on Wednesday, June 25, 2025.
AAJI recorded the claim value in 2021 at Rp 12.11 trillion. This figure increased to Rp 16.67 trillion in 2022, then soared to Rp 20.77 trillion in 2023. In 2024, claims reached Rp 24.18 trillion with 3.79 million beneficiaries.
Adil Al Hasan contributed to the writing of this article.
Editor's Choice: DPR and OJK Postpone Controversial Health Insurance Co-Payment Scheme
Click here to get the latest news updates from Tempo on Google News

author: AMG Realtors
title: NMG and AMG Realtors host day-long ceremony to champion empowerment of all women | Nation
text: NMG and AMG Realtors host day-long ceremony to champion empowerment of all women Sponsored by AMG Realtors On March 8, 2024, the Nation Media Group (NMG), in a landmark partnership with AMG Realtors, took the lead in celebrating women on International Women's Day (IWD) through a spectacular gala dinner that championed the advancements and empowerment of women from all walks of life. A total of 562 women graced the colourful ceremony that was held at the Windsor Golf Hotel & Country Club, Nairobi. The event became a confluence of culture, elegance, and inspiration, perfectly embodying this year's IWD theme of fostering inclusivity. With the dress code set to 'African Glam', the evening was a colourful tapestry of fashion, featuring a host of activities that ranged from networking opportunities and financial masterclasses, to golfing experiences. The dinner was a testament to the power of collaborative initiatives in elevating women's roles in society. The event was graced by notable keynote speakers. They included Kirinyaga County Governor and chairperson of the Council of Governors Anne Waiguru, representing the public sector; and the Managing Director of KCB Bank Kenya, Annastacia Kimtai, representing the private sector. Their inspiring addresses shone a spotlight on the strides women are making in shaping Kenya’s landscape on different fronts. A panel of distinguished women leaders, including Gwen Kinisu of Prudential Life Assurance and Blandina Ijecha Bobson of Oxfam Kenya, shared their profound stories and insights, enriching the conversation around women's challenges and triumphs. Their presence and discourse elevated the evening, inspiring those in attendance to contribute to a more equitable future. AMG Realtors Marketing Manager Rebecca Ngigi, spoke too, saying: “At AMG Realtors, we understand the unique strengths women bring to the real estate market. About 70 percent of our clients are women, and we are cognizant that now more than ever, many women are interested in understanding the nuances of the real estate market to make informed decisions.” She went on: “We sell land that we own. Our prices are all inclusive. We deliver your title deed within 60 days after payment completion. We deliver the title deed to your door step, and we have a permanent residence at AMG Centre. These pillars have enabled us to play a pivotal role in building the confidence of women in their investment endeavours, as well as empowering them with knowledge and guidance they need to thrive. We’ve done this for the last 12 years that we have been in business.” [NMG](https://www.nationmedia.com/) and [AMG Realtors](https://amgrealtors.com/), alongside other partners such as Ecobank Kenya and Prudential, have demonstrated an unwavering dedication to inclusivity through this event. By joining forces, these diverse entities have not only honoured the spirit of International Women's Day, but also set a high standard for corporate support in women's advancement. The gala dinner's overwhelming success was a reflection of the united vision shared by all sponsors – a society that values and uplifts each of its members. It was more than a celebration. It was a clarion call to action, urging continuous support for gender parity and diversity in the professional realm and beyond. As NMG forges ahead with allies like AMG Realtors to spotlight women's achievements, events like the International Women's Day gala dinner are pivotal to cultivating an environment where women's voices are heard and their successes celebrated. Continuing her speech, Ms Ngigi said: “Today, women are increasingly taking charge of their financial futures through real estate investment. At [AMG Realtors](https://amgrealtors.com/), we understand the importance of securing your family’s future by providing ready to build plots such as Juja Prime project, which has recorded an increased uptake by Kenyan women living or working in the diaspora, looking to settle their families back home in secure places with social amenities close by. We're committed to guiding you through every step of the real estate investment process, so you can achieve your homeownership goals with confidence.” You can learn more about AMG Realtors land projects from [https://amgrealtors.com/](https://amgrealtors.com/)

author: Envisionwise Website Service / LinkedUpRadio
title: Brewers top Rays to snap losing skid
text:
The Milwaukee Brewers snapped their four-game losing steak with a 5-3 win over the Tampa Bay Rays on Tuesday night at American Family Field.
Freddy Peralta (4-2) picked up his first win since returning from the injury list by going five innings and allowing only two hits and two runs.
Brewer Andrew McCutchen broke a 2-2 tie in the fifth inning with a single and Kolton Wong followed with a two-run double to help secure the Milwaukee win.
Matt Bush came on in the ninth inning to pick up his first save as a Brewer and struck out two batters without giving up a hit.
Milwaukee and Tampa Bay (58-51) will play the second game of the short series Wednesday at 1:10 pm before the Brewers (59-50) head to St. Louis for a crucial series against the division-leading Cardinals.

author: Ryan Glasspiegel
title: Chris Russo: My son's better at radio than Bronny James is at basketball
text:
Chris Russo stopped himself at first before deciding to go for it.
Russo has poured cold water on the idea that the public cares as much as the sports media does about Bronny James taking the court alongside his father LeBron for the Lakers on Tuesday night and said his son Colin is a better radio host than Bronny is a basketball player.
Thursday, the Mad Dog appeared on the “Dan Patrick Show” and was asked if he’d ever tell SiriusXM management he’d like to do a show with his son.
“Well, I wouldn’t say that. But I understand what your point is. I wouldn’t say that because these jobs are very difficult to get and I think that that advantage for him would be unfair. So I would not tell bosses, ‘Hey, do me a favor, make sure Colin Russo gets on Sirius and does a once-a-week show with me,” Russo answered.
4 Chris Russo (l.) and his son Colin Russo (r.) on the air together. Getty Images for SiriusXM 4 Bronny James (9) appears in his NBA debut alongside father LeBron James (23) in the Lakers’ opener on Oct. 22, 2024. NBAE via Getty Images Explore More Raygun looks unrecognizable as magazine cover girl after viral Olympic disaster Davante Adams refuses to stay silent after seeing glaring Jets issues Bill Belichick’s 24-year-old girlfriend hits back at radio personality over cheerleading comments Colin Russo, a 2024 graduate of the University of Wisconsin, co-hosts a show in afternoon drive on ESPN West Palm, a Good Karma affiliate.
His father, the radio legend who has had a renaissance through his appearances with Stephen A. Smith on ESPN’s “First Take,” initially thought better about what he was going to say next but got coaxed into it by Patrick.
“I’ll say this right now … well, I won’t say that because that will get me in trouble,” Russo said as Patrick chuckled.
“Your wife’s out of town. You can’t get in trouble,” Patrick said, having a good idea of what Russo was about to say.
Russo took the bait.
4 Chris Russo (l.) with his son Colin Russo (r.) Getty Images for SiriusXM 4 Bronny James (l.) and father LeBron James (r.) after the Lakers’ game against the Timberwolves on Oct. 22, 2024. NBAE via Getty Images “I’ll say it. Colin, from a radio perspective, he is better at what he does right now than Bronny at what he does. How’s that? I’ll say that with all sorts of confidence,” Russo said.
Bronny James played under three minutes on Tuesday night, and it remains to be seen if/when he will return to the court for the Lakers.

author: Jonas Erbas
title: Nach Statement: Schlagerstar enthüllt Klinikaufenthalt - „Psychosomatisches Problem"
text:
Nach Statement: Schlagerstar enthüllt Klinikaufenthalt – „Psychosomatisches Problem“
Es sind Enthüllungen mit Tiefgang: Schlagersänger Eric Philippi spricht erstmals über seine psychischen Probleme und seinen Aufenthalt in einer Klinik.
Köln – Schlagerstar Eric Philippi (28) hat sich zu einem schwerwiegenden persönlichen Thema geäußert. Nach monatelangem Schweigen macht der Verlobte von Michelle (53) nun öffentlich, warum er sich aus der Öffentlichkeit zurückgezogen hatte. Seine ehrlichen Worte sollen anderen Betroffenen Mut machen und ein wichtiges gesellschaftliches Thema in den Fokus rücken.
Schlagerstar öffnet sich: Eric Philippi lässt auf Worte Taten folgen
Wie unter anderem wa.de berichtet, hatte Eric Philippi kürzlich über Instagram angekündigt, über „Dinge, die sich immer hinter den Kulissen abgespielt haben“ sprechen zu wollen. Der 28-jährige Schlagerkünstler deutete damals an, dass es jahrelange Kämpfe gegeben habe, während nach außen hin alles perfekt erschien. Seine Fans fragten sich schon länger, warum Eric Philippi immer wieder von der Bildfläche verschwand.
Jetzt hat der Musiker gegenüber der Bild-Zeitung erstmals über seine mentalen Probleme gesprochen. „Ich habe seit langer Zeit ein psychosomatisches Problem, das sich vor allen Dingen durch Panikattacken äußert. Ich konnte nicht mehr am normalen Leben teilnehmen“, erklärte der „Schockverliebt“-Interpret. Anfang des Jahres hatte er sich für drei Monate in eine Privatklinik begeben.
Eric Philippi spricht offen über Panikattacken: Sie verhinderten seine Auftritte
Die Erkrankung hatte massive Auswirkungen auf die Karriere des Schlagersängers. „Die letzten Auftritte vor meiner Therapie waren kaum noch zu bewältigen und ich konnte gar nicht mehr allein unterwegs sein“, berichtete er weiter. Die Panikattacken begannen mit schwitzigen Händen und einem Puls von 150, gefolgt von Atemnot und der ständigen Angst zu sterben. Diese Symptome machten es zeitweise unmöglich, weiterhin als Entertainer zu arbeiten. Immer wieder hatte der Saarländer Konzerte absagen müssen – teils recht spontan.
Während seines Klinikaufenthalts erhielt Eric Philippi Unterstützung von seiner Verlobten Michelle. Die 53-jährige Schlagersängerin besuchte ihn regelmäßig in der Klinik. Rückblickend bezeichnet Philippi die Entscheidung für die Therapie als „eine der besten Entscheidungen meines Lebens“ – ein Schritt, von dem er sich inzwischen wünscht, ihn früher gegangen zu sein. Heute geht es ihm nach eigenen Angaben „so gut wie noch nie“. Übrigens: Die Hochzeit von Michelle und ihrem Eric muss wohl noch ein wenig warten. Verwendete Quellen: instagram.com/eric_philippi, bild.de, rtl.de

author: @infobae
title: Hija de Paquita la del Barrio sufre accidente al enterarse de la muerte de su madre - Infobae
text:
Paquita la del Barrio falleció el 17 de febrero en su hogar en Alto Lucero, Veracruz (Cuartoscuro) La noticia del fallecimiento de Paquita la del Barrio , ocurrido el pasado 17 de febrero en Alto Lucero, Veracruz, continúa generando impacto en el ámbito del entretenimiento y entre sus seguidores.
En medio de los preparativos para despedir a la icónica intérprete del regional mexicano, su hija adoptiva, Martha Elena , reveló que sufrió un accidente tras recibir la noticia de la muerte de su madre.
Según informó Imagen Televisión , la mujer presentó visibles lesiones en el rostro, lo que despertó la curiosidad de los medios.
De acuerdo con lo reportado por De primera mano , Martha Elena explicó que el accidente ocurrió en un momento de gran conmoción emocional. Al enterarse del fallecimiento de Paquita, sufrió una caída que le provocó golpes en la frente y la nariz .
Los hijos de la cantante mostraron tensiones familiares y división durante el velorio en Veracruz, según el periodista (Archivo) Aunque el incidente le causó sangrado, aseguró que no fue necesario acudir al hospital, ya que las heridas no pasaron de ser superficiales. “Cuando me dijeron que mi mamá se había muerto, me caí y me golpeé la cara; pero está bien, estoy bien”, declaró al medio en los funerales de la querida intérprete de temas como Cheque en blanco y Rata de dos patas .
Un adiós en su tierra natal El fallecimiento de Paquita la del Barrio, cuyo nombre real era Francisca Viveros Barradas , se produjo en su hogar en Alto Lucero, Veracruz, lugar que la vio nacer y donde decidió pasar sus últimos días.
La cantante murió a causa de un infarto fulminante mientras estaba acompañada por sus familiares. En los últimos meses, su estado de salud había empeorado, lo que la llevó a cancelar varias presentaciones programadas para enero.
Martha Elena, hija adoptiva de Paquita, administraba sus finanzas, generando conflictos con sus hermanos mayores, según Ceriani (Archivo) La familia de la artista organizó una misa religiosa en su honor en su tierra natal, como parte de los actos para despedirla. Este gesto refleja el profundo vínculo de Paquita con su lugar de origen, un aspecto que siempre destacó a lo largo de su carrera.
Su hermana, Viola Dorantes , quien estuvo presente en los últimos momentos de vida de la cantante, también compartió detalles sobre cómo la familia enfrentó esta pérdida.
En su encuentro con De primera mano, Martha Elena, quien fue adoptada por Paquita la del Barrio, habló sobre la relación que mantenía con la cantante y cómo ha vivido este difícil momento.
Aunque afirmó que no suele dar entrevistas, accedió a compartir su sentir con el medio. “No sé qué decir, pero fue una gran madre y yo estuve acompañándola”, expresó.
Martha Elena detalló cómo se golpeó el rostro Crédito: Imagen TV La hija adoptiva de la intérprete también mencionó que la noticia de su muerte fue completamente inesperada, lo que contribuyó al impacto emocional que derivó en su accidente. “Nos hablaron así de momento: ‘Tu mamá se murió’, y sí me impactó y me golpeé la cara”, explicó.
A pesar de la tristeza, Martha Elena destacó la fortaleza de su madre y el legado que deja en la música mexicana.
